data.title: C on LinkedIn: How to Explain the Israel
authors: Lauren A. Tetenbaum, LCSW, JD, PMH-C
data.meta_description:
I spoke to New York Family about how to talk to your children about the war.

It's been difficult to process the last 10 days since Israel was targeted in…
data.text:
Join us for an inspiring LinkedIn Live event, Episode 1, celebrating the launch of the transformative anthology, "Own Your Story: Empower. Connect. Create Change," on Thursday, July 18th at 8 PM ET. Stories have the incredible power to transform: they foster empathy, create connections, and remind us that we are more alike than different. In this anthology, women from diverse backgrounds, lived experiences, professions, and ages come together to share their unique stories. These narratives encompass growth, change, loss, love, enlightenment, strength, and resilience. Through their vulnerability, they remind us that authenticity is empowering—and they lead by example. During this live event, you'll hear from some of the contributing authors as they discuss their journeys and the impact of sharing their stories. 𝐖𝐡𝐞𝐧 𝐋𝐢𝐟𝐞 𝐓𝐡𝐫𝐨𝐰𝐬 𝐘𝐨𝐮 𝐚 𝐂𝐮𝐫𝐯𝐞 𝐁𝐚𝐥𝐥 … 𝐛𝐲 𝐉𝐞𝐧𝐧𝐢𝐟𝐞𝐫 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐨 𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐛𝐨𝐝𝐚𝐮𝐱 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝟑 𝐑𝐬 𝐨𝐟 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐛𝐲 𝐋𝐞𝐬𝐥𝐞𝐲 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐥𝐢𝐧 𝐆𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐭 𝐄𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬: 𝐀 𝐋𝐨𝐯𝐞 𝐋𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐭𝐨 𝐖𝐨𝐦𝐞𝐧 𝐛𝐲 𝐋𝐚𝐮𝐫𝐞𝐧 𝐀. 𝐓𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐛𝐚𝐮𝐦 𝐖𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐈 𝐖𝐚𝐬 𝐌𝐚𝐝𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐛𝐲 𝐌𝐢𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐌. 𝐁𝐮𝐟𝐚𝐧𝐨 𝐔𝐧𝐞𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐞𝐝𝐥𝐲 𝐑𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐞𝐝: 𝐋𝐨𝐬𝐬 𝐭𝐨 𝐏𝐨𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐲 𝐛𝐲 𝐀𝐧𝐧𝐞 𝐒𝐭𝐚𝐫𝐤 𝐆𝐚𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐠𝐡𝐞𝐫 𝐁𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐤𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐒𝐭𝐢𝐠𝐦𝐚 𝐛𝐲 𝐒𝐮𝐬𝐚𝐧 𝐄. 𝐅𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐤𝐞𝐥 𝐁𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐤𝐬 𝐃𝐨𝐧’𝐭 𝐃𝐞𝐟𝐢𝐧𝐞 𝐘𝐨𝐮, 𝐓𝐡𝐞𝐲 𝐑𝐞𝐟𝐢𝐧𝐞 𝐘𝐨𝐮 𝐛𝐲 𝐌𝐚𝐫𝐜𝐢𝐞 𝐃𝐢𝐜𝐤𝐬𝐨𝐧 𝐈𝐧𝐧𝐨𝐯𝐚𝐭𝐞 & 𝐂𝐡𝐚𝐧𝐠𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐒𝐮𝐜𝐜𝐞𝐞𝐝 𝐛𝐲 𝐍𝐢𝐭𝐚 𝐒𝐚𝐧𝐠𝐞𝐫 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐏𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫 𝐨𝐟 𝐎𝐰𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐘𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐒𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐲 𝐛𝐲 𝐒𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐚 𝐌𝐚𝐬𝐭𝐢𝐧 𝐋𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐭𝐨 𝐓𝐡𝐫𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐍𝐨𝐭 𝐉𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝐒𝐮𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐛𝐲 𝐌𝐢𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐖𝐢𝐦𝐞𝐬 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐒𝐮𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐯𝐨𝐫’𝐬 𝐉𝐨𝐮𝐫𝐧𝐞𝐲 𝐛𝐲 𝐋𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐬𝐚𝐲 𝐆𝐫𝐢𝐟𝐟𝐢𝐭𝐡𝐬 Discover how their experiences can inspire and empower you to create change in your own life and the world around you. Let's harness the power of storytelling to empower, connect, and create change. Don't miss this opportunity to be part of a community that values authenticity, strength, and the transformative power of stories. Order your copy here: https://lnkd.in/e_wUvxRj OWN YOUR STORY: EMPOWER. CONNECT. CREATE CHANGE. Want to create live streams like this? Check out StreamYard: https://lnkd.in/eHAAVX3X

Oh hey there, expecting/new parents! We’ve got your back. 👍 Dozens of seasoned "old-timers" paid it forward so that you, future generations, can have access to trusted resources that much easier. And can figure out this parenting thing that much faster. 🙌 They wished, so you didn’t have to. 💫 Grab your copy now with a bajillion resources… Did we miss anything?! Let us know 👇 Erin Grau, Vivvi, Clara Lucia Carrier, M.A., PCC, Sarah Sherry, PACE, Michelle Yu, Janki Bhoti, Flex Your No, The Motherhood Center of New York, Lauren A. Tetenbaum, LCSW, JD, PMH-C #IWishIHadThis #myjosie #empowerment #workingmoms #workingdads #workingparents #caregivers #maternityleave #paternityleave #parentalleave #returntowork #futureofwork #postpartum #postpartumwellness #communitygroups #freeresource

It was great to discuss social media and mental health with Kara Alaimo, Fairleigh Dickinson University; author & Lauren A. Tetenbaum, LCSW, JD, PMH-C, founder, The CounseLaur. * Links to full convo in comments We discussed a few things including: 1. Their career journeys 2. The mental health crisis 3. Kara's research and new book, Over the Influence 4. Lauren's counseling practice 5. Trends, challenges and opportunities related to social media and mental health Kara Alaimo, PhD, is a communication professor at Fairleigh Dickinson University, where she created the university’s academic programs in social media. Her book Over the Influence: Why Social Media is Toxic for Women and Girls – And How We Can Take It Back, which explains how social media is affecting every aspect of the lives of women and girls and what we can do about it, was published in March. She has been writing for CNN Opinion about the social impact of social media and issues affecting women and girls since 2016. She is a former spokesperson in the Obama administration and communicator at the United Nations and speaks frequently to parents and students in schools about how to handle kids’ social media use. For more information, visit www.karaalaimo.com and follow her on Instagram, Facebook and X. --- Lauren Tetenbaum, LCSW, JD, PMH-C is a mother of two, a writer, a former lawyer, and a social worker specializing in supporting millennial moms and young women through life transitions. Through her counseling practice, Lauren facilitates psychoeducational groups and coaching workshops to empower postpartum and other women in corporate settings, provides therapy to individuals and couples in New York, Connecticut, and Florida, and contributes thought leadership on topics like maternal mental health, gender equity, and working parenthood. Learn more about Lauren at www.TheCounseLaur.com or connect with her on Instagram (@thecounselaur) or LinkedIn. #mentalhealth #socialmedia #podcast #afewthingspodcast
